title: Should I use first or third person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on the context. If you are writing a story, both are fine. If you are writing for an academic paper or a nonfiction piece it is generally better to write in third person and only write in first person if you want it to be an opinion piece.

In academic and some formal writing first person has become acceptable to some. However, the vast majority of teachers, professors and other professionals find it unacceptable. As a writing teacher, I have never and will never allow first person in anything except a personal anecdote. Even then I often demand it to be written in third person with the writer as an outside narrator.
